spark: Good Morning, I love you
What you practice grows stronger
Our thoughts and habits shape our brains overtime
It’s alright to make mistakes. I’m still learning
It’s normal to feel insecure sometimes
You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn how to surf
What magical, unexpected thing might happen today
To a large extent, happiness is a choice
We can rewire our brains, shift our perspective, and find moments of peace and joy - no matter what.
Treat yourself as you would a close friend
Welcome all emotions- and notice how they come and go
Smile more, practice gratitude, look for small moments of beauty in your daily life
Stop relying on societal markers of success - like wealth, status, approval - and instead build a life that resonates with your unique purpose
If setbacks happen - and they will - remember that failure is only permanent if you give up
Building momentum is about consistency, resilience, and self-belief
Mistakes often happen due to poor advice, overlooked steps, or sheer bad luck
Replace criticism with compassion, endless striving with genuine contentment, rigid rules with flexibility
Being enough isn’t about being perfect— it’s about being authentically, imperfectly, wonderfully yourself
Making mistakes and feeling inadequate sometimes is simply part of being human
When you notice yourself slipping into harsh criticism — pause and choose compassion instead
Being human means sometimes falling short
Productivity isn’t about being perfect — it’s about making progress. And even mistakes can be a part of that progress
Allow yourself to be human — sometimes messy, sometimes joyful, always real
Kindness is the surest path to the growth
People don’t care how much you know until they know how much you care
Real love means accepting your partner as they are, not as you wish them to be
If someone doesn’t love you, no amount of proving your worth will change that fundamental reality
If I have to convince you, it’s already a no
Someone’s capacity to love you isn’t a reflection of your lovability. It’s simply their capacity
While relationships can enrich our lives, they can’t fill our inner emptiness or heal our deepest wounds
Love cannot be forced or won
Always aim to show them that your message isn’t just about you - it’s about how it matters to them
We are born in a default state of happiness
Happiness is not something you find - it’s something you reclaim by managing your thoughts
Much of our suffering comes from living outside the present - from regretting the past or fearing the future
When we lack the information, our brains fill in the gaps — often based on past experiences, biases, or incomplete logic
Nothing is guaranteed and life may be unpredictable and it can also be radiant — if we let it
PCLL: Presence, Change, Love, Loss
Happiness = your (perception of events) - (expectations of life)
Suffering stems from the gap between what is and what we think should be
Our brains were designed not for happiness, but for survival
Life is defined by movement — our thoughts, our relationships, even our bodies are always changing
Happiness = Reality - Expectations
You are not your thoughts - you are the observer behind them
When your goals and the company’s priorities overlap, you’re in a position for both security and growth

Rule of three:
    * Does this excite me?
    * Will it pay?
    * Does it support a cause I care about?
The goal isn’t perfection. It is about doing your best with intention, integrity, and heart. And maybe, just maybe, that’s the answer to why we’re here.
Keep flowing, keep creating, don’t overthink, and have fun

When life feels heavy? 
    * Get outside. 
    * Walk. 
    * Think. 
    * Breathe.
Take the action first, and confidence follows
Just because you think something doesn’t mean it is true — it is a thought, not a fact
It’s all about progress, not perfection
You are not the sum of your thoughts but actually separate from them
At its best, work becomes the play of adulthood, just as play is the work of childhood
There is nothing either good or bad, “but thinking makes it so”.
Our bodies live in the Information age but our brains are prehistoric
Our worth must be tied to effort rather than achievements
Healthy relationships thrive when you make choices that align with your priorities rather than reacting to external pressures
Develop an inner compass guided by your values instead of others’ expectations
Stop treating others’ opinions as your life’s compass
By seeing others with a little more compassion, you can stay calm and kind in turn
The best we can do is to be grateful when we are feeling good and graceful when we are feeling bad
Bad moods and difficult times will pass. No need to panic, no need to struggle — just be graceful
You become what you practice most
Breathe in, count one. Breathe out, relax. Keep going all the way to ten.
The only way to truly be happy is to appreciate what you already have.
We all know deep down that ignoring things only makes them worse.
Too much negative thinking will bring negativity into your life
What thoughts make you happy? What activities and people make you feel good
Character equals convictions multiplied by discipline (convictions * discipline)
Real leadership often means doing what people need rather than what they want
Good leadership emerges through daily choices to serve others and be present when needed, not through positional authority
Discipline isn’t about perfection, but about consistent actions, even when you fail
Your intuition often knows more than you think
Battling your mind often backfires, making unwanted thoughts and feelings even stronger
When emotions rise, mentally step back and notice the whole scene then respond thoughtfully instead of escalating
Your thoughts, your emotions, and your experiences don’t define you. You’re the awareness that can notice all these things
Think of emotional pain like a teacher who sometimes delivers tough lessons, fighting against the lesson usually just prolongs the learning process
Move forward anyway
Fighting with your thoughts or emotions only makes them stronger, but you can learn to watch them pass like weather across the sky of your awareness instead
The path to psychological flexibility isn’t about perfection but about dancing with life as it unfolds, one step at a time.
